p: The results presented herein show that species in the genus Glandularia and Junellia may be considered genetically similar as were forming one group (Fig.Â 4), thus confirming former results [ 42]. Furthermore, the species used as an outgroup, Phyla canescens, showed clear genetic divergence from Lantana, Glandularia, Junellia and Lippia, even though the separation of these genus has been proposed based on increased morphological descriptors [ 43, 44].
